value.verse: Happy are they who consider the poor and needy! *
value.halfverse: the LORD will deliver them in the time of trouble.
he does not hand them over to the will of their enemies.
value.verse:
The LORD preserves them and keeps them alive,
so that they may be happy in the land; *
The LORD sustains them on their sickbed *
value.halfverse: and ministers to them in their illness.

value.verse: I said, “LORD, be merciful to me; *
value.halfverse: heal me, for I have sinned against you.”

value.verse: My enemies are saying wicked things about me: *
value.halfverse: “When will he die, and his name perish?”

their heart collects false rumors;
 they go outside and spread them.
value.verse: Even if they come to see me, they speak empty words; *
All my enemies whisper together about me *

value.halfverse: he has taken to his bed and will never get up again.”
value.verse: “A deadly thing,” they say, “has fastened on him; *

value.halfverse: has lifted up his heel and turned against me.
value.verse:
Even my best friend, whom I trusted,
who broke bread with me, *
But you, O LORD, be merciful to me and raise me up, *

value.halfverse: that my enemy does not triumph over me.
value.verse: By this I know you are pleased with me, *
In my integrity you hold me fast, *
value.halfverse: and shall set me before your face for ever.
from age to age. Amen. Amen.
value.verse: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, *
